revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Gigabyte |model=GN-A17GU |revision= |asin= |price=108 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=EoL |est_release_date=01/2004 |fcc_date= |fcc_id= <!-- JCK-GN-WIAG --> |ic_id= |type=access point |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Renesas |cpu1_model=HD6417751R |cpu1_cspeed=240 |fla1=4 |fla1_brand=AMD |fla1_model=AM29LV320DB-90EI |ram1=16 |ram1_brand=ICSI |ram1_model=IC42S16400-6T |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=PCMCIA (32-bit), Mini PCI |expansion_pcmcia_num=1 |expansion_minipci_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Gigabyte GN-WIAG101 |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR5212 |wi1_chip2_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip2_model=AR2112 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand=Realtek |eth_chip1_model=RTL8100;RTL8100BL; |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid=GIGABYTE |default_ssid_regex=^GIGABYTE$ |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:20:ED |oui_eth=00:20:ED }} {{TagLine|Wireless Access Point}} :[http://www.gigabyte.com/products/product-page.aspx?pid=946 Product page] w/ links to downloads (GPL code accessible as of 2013-10-09) :[http://download.gigabyte.us/FileList/Manual/comm_manual_gn-a17gu_e.pdf Manual]
This has a CardBus slot to add an additional (optional) 11a radio module :(such as the [[Gigabyte GN-WLMA101]], [[Gigabyte GN-WIAG101]] - 11bg).
===Specifications=== Specifications are likely quite similar to the [[Gigabyte GN-BR404W]] - the toolchain :for the BR404W is included in the GPL code package provided by ''[[Gigabyte]]''. :<small>CONFIG_SH_7751R_GIGABYTE_PLATFORM</small> is set in the kernel config. It is assumed to be using the same SH4 CPU (''[[Renesas]]'' HD6417751R) used by the BR404W. :The latest firmware for the device is using the Linux 2.4.20 kernel.
Addtional specifications, per ''Gigabyte'''s manual, follow... *Operating temperature range: 0 to 40 degrees Celsius *Storage temperature range: -20 to 65 degrees Celsius *Humidity range: 10% to 85%, non-condensing *Dimensions: [[Dimensions::178 mm x 132 mm x 43 mm]] *Gross weight: [[Weight::320 g]] ± 5 g
Default settings (including the SSID) are per ''Gigabyte'''s manual.
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/24680-quickviewgna17gu On '''SmallNetBuilder'''] (dated June 29, 2004) *[http://www.tomsguide.com/us/quick-view-gna17gu,review-280-2.html On '''Tom's Guide'''] • [http://www.thg.ru/network/200408092/ On '''Tom's Hardware Guide''' (RU)] :The '''Gigabyte''' logo, "GC-A17GU", and "REV 1.1" is silkscreened on the top of the board. :A date code of '''0352''' (December 2003) appears to be etched onto the bottom of the board. :''[[Renesas]]'' SH7751R based, as expected; [[TI]] PCI 1410 PC Card Controller :2x ''ICSI'' RAM (IC42S16400-6T?); [[Realtek]] RTL8100BL PCI 100M Controller :WiFi: [[Atheros]] AR5002G (Super-G) chipset; Retail price of $108 US *[http://www.pcstats.com/articleview.cfm?articleID=1536 On '''pcstats.com'''], dated Feb. 02, 2004 :00:20:ED OUIs
==Images== http://www.thg.ru/network/200408092/images/gig_gna17gu_board_top.jpg http://www.thg.ru/network/200408092/images/gig_gna17gu_board_bottom.jpg
